pages.text: Micromitra hails from the Middle to Upper Cambrian, with fossils found in the Burgess Shale, Canada. It is a semi-circular brachiopod, that was suspended above the seafloor via a small stalk, and grew up to 1 cm in overall size. The generic name derives from the Greek words 'mikros', to mean 'small'; and 'mitra', to mean 'turban'.
